channel.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
channel.description:
Well, seems like we've discovered something else, fascinating to me to be honest:
http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/46467275/ns/technology_and_science-space/#.T0RcQfFumFA

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Frell:

It could take days for the smoke to cover that 500mri area, the first 100 miles is what would get “surprised.”

I wouldn’t necessarily say days. But they would more time than people in the first 100 miles.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

But it could also erupt without any warnings. No one knows because no one has witnessed one erupt.

I’m sure we have the technology to detect the slightest pressure change below it that could lead to something. I see what you’re saying though (meaning it could change fast enough where we can’t respond).

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Demo_, post:42, topic:433803”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=536519.msg3923630#msg3923630 date=1329968200]

I havent seen any subterranean scans or anything to show anything thats capable of creating such a vast volume of gas. We don’t know if he means toxic gas in the air, pitch black gas in the air, whether its going to be in the atmosphere or from the ground to the atmosphere. I think the main thing that will happen is forests will die along with alot of animals, thats about it.

You’re forgetting humans in the last part.

You’re forgetting we aren’t fucking barbarians sleeping under rocks.

Okay, please tell me how you’re going to predict when it’s going erupt and to be ready for it.
[/quote]

As they said in the video, they’re constantly monitoring it. As soon as they see the signs they will most likely do something, such as evacuation’s etc. I don’t know how they’d do that with millions of people, but they’ll do something.[/quote]

But it could also erupt without any warnings. No one knows because no one has witnessed one erupt.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @Demo1 Demo_
item.description:
@Demo1 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:40, topic:433803”][quote author=Frell link=topic=536519.msg3923543#msg3923543 date=1329961166]

I havent seen any subterranean scans or anything to show anything thats capable of creating such a vast volume of gas. We don’t know if he means toxic gas in the air, pitch black gas in the air, whether its going to be in the atmosphere or from the ground to the atmosphere. I think the main thing that will happen is forests will die along with alot of animals, thats about it.

You’re forgetting humans in the last part.

You’re forgetting we aren’t fucking barbarians sleeping under rocks.
[/quote]

Okay, please tell me how you’re going to predict when it’s going erupt and to be ready for it.[/quote]

As they said in the video, they’re constantly monitoring it. As soon as they see the signs they will most likely do something, such as evacuation’s etc. I don’t know how they’d do that with millions of people, but they’ll do something.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

PS - Mount St Helens. Look at the ash cloud from that. That one I can literally see from my house.

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Frell:

“we don’t know exactly what would happen, we can only speculate”

Obviously. You don’t know anything exactly until it actually happens, that’s why we use models to determine what will happen.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

What? The point is it wouldn’t linger. Not only that, even if you asked him (who I am very familiar with) hell probably say “we don’t know exactly what would happen, we can only speculate” Not everything they say is spot on true. They have no other supervolcanos on record to judge the aftermath. It will be bad but it wouldnt ruin the world or anything. Yes, they have spent decades researching this stuff, thats why theyre able to monitor it. Dont hold them to that precision when it comes to the future. We still suck at predicting weather.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:24, topic:433803”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=536519.msg3923374#msg3923374 date=1329949981]
I love how none of us are geologists or vulcanology yet we argue about how much damage a super volcano can do.
[/quote]
Well no its just people like you are overly ignorant and will take any news report and run with it and try and show off by “shocking” people. You think these scientists would get as much R&D funding as they do if they didn’t over-hype a story every now and then? Im not saying theyre wrong, im sure it will be devastating, but it wont look like fallout 3 here :P[/quote]

In all honesty, I do hope something like this occurs. I’m not overly ignorant, I am simply putting what little faith I have in the human mind on someone who has spent the majority of their life studying this type of thing.

I’m not a master of maps but that looks like the jetstream is blowing towards the east coast? The other half of the country will be shrouded in toxic gas.

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'

item.title: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Nope as usual media blows it out of proportion.

The major damage radius is only 100 miles. The rest is from the ash/gas, but what they don’t realize is that yellowstone is located under a major jetstream which would carry the gas away very quickly. In fact this very same jet stream was used by the japanese when they tied bombs to weather balloons and sent them over the pacific. Google “japanese balloon bombs”


m1lkman:

I love how none of us are geologists or vulcanology yet we argue about how much damage a super volcano can do.

Well no its just people like you are overly ignorant and will take any news report and run with it and try and show off by “shocking” people. You think these scientists would get as much R&D funding as they do if they didn’t over-hype a story every now and then? Im not saying theyre wrong, im sure it will be devastating, but it wont look like fallout 3 here

Read full topic
item.source: Alien World 'Like No Planet We Know Of'
